div.a: The New American Academy Charter School
The New American Academy Charter School
div.div: The New American Academy Charter School

div.class: sqs-layout sqs-grid-12 columns-12 Intro-content sqs-alternate-block-style-container empty

div.span: Governor Andrew Cuomo's executive order requires all New Yorkers to wear masks or face coverings in public.

div.p: The safety of our community is top priority at TNAACS. We are following the guidelines presented by state officials to ensure that all community members are safe. As of Monday March 16th until at least April 17th school building will be closed. During the week of March 16th faculty and staff will work to extend our rigorous education to a remote learning platform.

li.p: We will continue to share updated information with our community through robo calls, emails, phone messages, and social media. If you do not receive messages directly from the school please contact us here.

div.p: Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is responding to the COVID-19, a respiratory disease spreading from person to person, by working closely with state, local and public health officials. Symptoms of the COVID-19 range from mild to severe illness or death. These symptoms may appear 2-14days after exposure.
*If you are experiencing these symptoms please consult your medical doctor.
For more information please visit CDC website.

li.p: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds especially after you have been in a public place, or after blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing.
If soap and water are not readily available, use a hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol. Cover all surfaces of your hands and rub them together until they feel dry.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick
Put distance between yourself and other people if COVID-19 is spreading in your community. This is especially important for people who are at higher risk of getting very sick.
Stay home if you are sick, except to get medical care. Learn what to do if you are sick.

Cover your mouth and nose with a tissue when you cough or sneeze or use the inside of your elbow. Immediately wash your hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. If soap and water are not readily available, clean your hands with a hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol.

If you are sick wear a facemask. CDC does not recommend healthy individuals wearing a facemask unless you are caring for someone who is sick. Facemasks may be in short supply and should be saved for caregivers.
Clean AND disinfect frequently touched surfaces daily. This includes tables, doorknobs, light switches, countertops, handles, desks, phones, keyboards, toilets, faucets, and sinks.
NY State procedures are fluid depending on the demand and need to contain the virus.
Please call 311 with questions or visit NY State Department of Health webpage for further information.

div.p: Internet - New York Charter Schools have created a information page on the possible internet options for families. Please check out the document complied to help families with their remote learning.

New York State is working on opening regional enrichment centers for the children of health care workers, first responders and other emergency service workers. Below is the information sent by NYCDOE. Please read through and click the provided link to complete the form sent by DOE.

Thank you for your service in keeping New Yorkers safe during this extraordinary time.
Please complete this form (CLICK HERE) for each child you are seeking to enroll at a Regional Enrichment Center.
Regional Enrichment Centers will be open 7:30am - 6:00pm Monday-Friday, starting on Monday, March 23rd. Children who are enrolled can attend anytime during open hours.
Regional Enrichment Centers are only open to children who are New York City residents, and whose parents/guardians are in certain fields noted below (initially: health care, FDNY, NYPD, OEM and some NYCTA roles). You will receive confirmation of your enrollment status and next steps shortly.
As enrollment progresses we will assess capacity and demand and will work to expand eligibility to additional essential personnel and children most in need of this support.
